Package com.swop

Class ProgramArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swop.ProgramArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PushBlocks
    public class ProgramArea
extends java.lang.Object
implements PushBlocks
    A program area that handles drops of blocks in it for constructing program(s). It has no notion of position or width or height.

      Sets the next block to the first block from the program list if the program list is not empty, otherwise to null.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllBlocks

        public java.util.List<Block> getAllBlocks()

      • getProgram

        public java.util.List<Block> getProgram()

      • dropBlockIn

        public void dropBlockIn​(Block draggedBlock,
                        java.awt.Point position)

      • dropBlock

        public void dropBlock​(Block draggedBlock)

      • getNextProgramBlock

        public Block getNextProgramBlock()
        Returns:
        Returns the next to be executed block. This is not necessarily the next to be executed block, rather it is the next in the list (can be a statement).

      • setNextProgramBlock

        public void setNextProgramBlock()
        Sets the next block to the next block from the program list, otherwise to null. This is not necessarily the next to be executed block, rather it is the next in the list (can be a statement).

      • resetNextProgramBlock

        public void resetNextProgramBlock()
        Sets the next block to the first block from the program list if the program list is not empty, otherwise to null.

      • getBlockAt

        public Block getBlockAt​(int x,
                        int y)
        Parameters:
        x - Given x coordinate.
        y - Given y coordinate.
        Returns:
        returns the block at the given position (x,y) if that block exists otherwise null will be returned.

      • removeBlockFromPA

        public void removeBlockFromPA​(Block clickedBlock)
        Remove the clickedBlock from this program area
        Parameters:
        clickedBlock - block that's dragged

      • resetProgramExecution

        public void resetProgramExecution()
        Resets the program area, first block will be current block.

      • restore

        public void restore​(java.util.List<Block> allBlocks,
                    java.util.List<Block> program,
                    Block nextProgramBlock)
        Set the Program Area Blocks, Program Blocks and next-to-be-executed Block.
        Parameters:
        allBlocks - List of Block elements to fill the Program Area Blocks.
        program - List of Block elements to fill the Program Blocks.
        nextProgramBlock - Block.
